summary: The Nurses for Under-Resourced Schools Everywhere Act (NURSE Act) aims to increase the number of school nurses in public elementary and secondary schools through demonstration grants. These grants, awarded by the Secretary of Education, will go to eligible local educational agencies or consortia. The bill prioritizes high-need LEAs. The act defines terms like "eligible entity", "nurse", and "workload". The Secretary is required to submit a report to Congress evaluating the program's effectiveness and impact on student health and learning. Funding is authorized for fiscal years 2026-2030.
